Summary: Saw object flying west to east, stop for few seconds, then change direction and fly out.
trends: There have been 15 other sightings in Hamilton
There were no other sightings in Hamilton on or around August 16th 2010
divs: sighting detailsi was out on my balcony skywatching,as now that i am retired, i tend to be a bit of night person. it was an exceptionally clear night, quite windy, and any clouds were quickly blown away. my balcony faces north. i was looking at a group of stars almost directly above, but slightly north. i was using a set of high powered field glasses\ binoculars. i noticed a silver disc shaped object move away from the star cluster and fly for a short bit going east. it then stopped, and sat still for a few seconds after which it changed direction by about 45 degrees and headed in a mostly north\north east direction. i thought, at first,that it may be a satellite, but realized quickly that they do not stop, change direction or leave orbit. when i moved the field glasses away from my eyes i could not see it, so it was far enough out that it could only be seen with them. after several seconds it flew out of sight, straight out. i felt as though it was 'scouting' or searching for something. at this point i must tell you that this is not the first time i have seen a 'ufo'. i am sixty years old now, and have had several of these encounters, the first one being when i was 15 years old. the subsequent ones were incidents where the crafts got so close that i could easily see the shape, size, lights, etc. i must say, however, that at no point did i feel uneasy or scared. quite the opposite, in fact. i do have them logged, but sadly, only as as afterthought, so the specific time and date were only as close as i could remember.luckily, i do remember what i was doing each time, so the dates are fairly close to the actual. i must add that every time i always had another witness with me, but not the same one for every incident. i would welcome any queries, as i have never before made any official reports. thank you for taking the time to read this.
